alert.note: Alert for Bayfield (Wisconsin) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Duluth (Northeast Minnesota and Northern Wisconsin)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 13 at 1:25PM CDT until further notice by NWS Duluth
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING FOR SNOWMELT NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 415 PM CDT SATURDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by snowmelt continues. * WHERE...A portion of northwest Wisconsin, including the following areas, Bayfield and Douglas County. * WHEN...Until 415 PM CDT Saturday. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. County, township and forest roads may flood, especially in low lying areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 122 PM CDT, Flooding from snow melt will continue. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Iron River, Maple, Brule, Poplar, Oulu, Port Wing, Cloverland, Waino, Mouth Of Brule, Blueberry and Wentworth. - Flood safety information can be found at www.weather.gov/safety/flood.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and to the National Weather Service in Duluth when you can do so safely. Flooding can be reported to the National Weather Service at 1-800-685-8612.
